translation.title: Kiwix
translation.home-welcome-text:
You can search the content of your ZIM archive by typing in the above search field.
It will suggest articles starting with the letters you type.
translation.home-btn-random-tip: Select a random article to display
translation.configure-download-instructions: This application needs a ZIM archive to work. For download instructions, please see the About section.
translation.configure-select-instructions: Please select or drag and drop the .zim file (or all the .zimaa, .zimab etc in case of a split ZIM file).
translation.configure-selectordisplay: Drag and drop a new ZIM file, or display file selectors.
translation.configure-supportedarchives: Only Mediawiki-based (wiki*.zim* files, like wikipedia), StackExchange and some video-based ZIMs (e.g. TEDx) have been fully tested
translation.configure-dynamic-content: Dynamic content is not currently supported in jQuery mode.
translation.configure-display-uianimations-tip: The animation is on by default and can be disabled by unchecking this option.
translation.configure-display-homekeyfocus: Use Home key to focus search bar (may rarely have side effects on ZIM files that handle Home key)
translation.configure-display-homekeyfocus-tip: Enables quick access to search, no matter where you are in an article.
translation.configure-display-openexternallinks: Open external links in new tabs. Disabling this might break kiwix-js UI in some specific cases
translation.configure-display-openexternallinks-tip: Opens the external links outside kiwix-js (avoids some side-effects affecting kiwix-js UI).
translation.configure-display-selectapptheme-tip: Allows selection of themes either for the app only, or for the app and the loaded content.
translation.configure-display-apptheme-auto-descript: (Auto themes match the dark/light mode of your device.)
translation.configure-display-apptheme-mwinvert-desc: * Implements workarounds specific to Wikimedia ZIMs. Try generic option if there are display errors with recent ZIMs.
translation.configure-performance-cacheassets-descri: Kiwix JS can speed up the display of articles by caching assets:
translation.configure-performance-cacheassets-true-t: The cache provides high-speed access to ZIM assets such as stylesheets and scripts, which will improve article load times.
translation.configure-performance-cacheassets-false: Do not cache assets (empties caches: for low-memory devices)
translation.configure-performance-cacheassets-false-: For low-memory devices, caching assets may cause app instability. This option allows you to disable the cache.
translation.configure-performance-searchrange-label: Select max number of search results:
translation.configure-performance-searchrange-help: default 25, higher values increase search time
translation.configure-compatibility-helpstub: for an explanation of the difference between these modes:
translation.configure-compatibility-option-servicewo: ServiceWorker (recommended, supports dynamic content and inline JavaScript)

This mode requires that the browser or framework be capable of installing a Service Worker. It enables dynamic ZIM content and running JavaScript (including inline JS). It works by intercepting the browser's Fetch calls and supplying the requested content from the ZIM.
ServiceWorkerLocal (secure local Service Worker, but no inline JavaScript)

[For Chromium extensions only:] This mode runs the Service Worker in a secure local sandbox, and does not need one-time access to our PWA server. However, due to the strong security restrictions in the API, it is not capable of running inline JavaScript, so dynamic ZIM content may fail.
translation.configure-compatibility-option-jquery: JQuery (deprecated: no dynamic content, compatible with older browsers)
translation.configure-compatibility-option-jquery-ti: This mode is deprecated, but should be fine for Wikipedia / WikiMedia archives. It works on all devices.
translation.configure-expert-hideactivecontentwarnin: Permanently hide active content warning (for experienced users)
A warning is shown if you load a ZIM that has active or dynamic content while you are in JQuery mode. It is not recommended to disable this warning.
translation.configure-expert-disabledragdrop: Disable drag-and-drop (in case it is causing anomalies)
translation.configure-expert-disabledragdrop-tip: This option disables drag-and-drop of ZIM files onto the app. It is not recommended to disable this feature.
translation.configure-expert-bypassappcache-tip: WARNING: Leaving this checked will prevent offline usage of the PWA. Setting will clear all existing Cache API caches, but assetsCache will be used unless also disabled above. For testing new code with the PWA.
translation.configure-expert-resetapp-description: Reset the app to default settings and erase all caches:
translation.configure-expert-resetapp-tip: This will return the app to its original settings on launch, and will empty all caches and settings and deregister Service Workers. The app will then reload.
translation.api-serviceworker-available-unregistered: ServiceWorker API: available, but not registered
translation.dialog-bypassappcachecheck-message: This setting can only be used in ServiceWorker mode!
translation.dialog-bypassappcache-conflict-message: You must deselect the "Bypass AppCache" option before switching to JQuery mode!
translation.dialog-disabledragdrop-message:
We will now attempt to reload the app to apply the new setting.

(If you cancel, then the setting will only be applied when you next start the app.)
translation.dialog-launchlocal-message:
This will switch to using locally packaged code only. Some configuration settings may be lost.

WARNING: After this, you may not be able to switch back to SW mode without an online connection!
translation.dialog-launchpwa-unsupported-message:
Unfortunately, your browser does not appear to support ServiceWorker mode, which is now the default for this app.

You can continue to use the app in the (now deprecated) JQuery mode, but note that this mode only works well with ZIM archives that have static content, such as Wikipedia / Wikimedia ZIMs or Stackexchange.

If you can, we recommend that you update your browser to a version that supports ServiceWorker mode.
translation.dialog-messagechannel-unsupported-messag: The MessageChannel API is not available on your device. Falling back to JQuery mode...
translation.dialog-reset-warning-message: This will reset the app to a freshly installed state, deleting all app caches and settings!
translation.dialog-serviceworker-unsupported-message:
Unfortunately, your browser does not appear to support ServiceWorker mode, which is now the default for this app.

You can continue to use the app in the (now deprecated) JQuery mode, but note that this mode only works well with ZIM archives that have static content, such as Wikipedia / Wikimedia ZIMs or Stackexchange.

If you can, we recommend that you update your browser to a version that supports ServiceWorker mode.
translation.dialog-serviceworker-defaultmodechange-t: Change of default content injection mode
translation.dialog-serviceworker-defaultmodechange-m:
We have switched you to ServiceWorker mode (this is now the default). It supports more types of ZIM archives and is much more robust.

If you experience problems with this mode, you can switch back to the (now deprecated) JQuery mode. In that case, please report the problems you experienced to us (see About section).
